formElement.label: Server Pool or Resource:
formElement.documentation: The resource or one of the pool resources where the DSL files will be checked out from git and imported to the CD/RO server.

formElement.label: Destination Directory:
formElement.documentation: The directory on the resource where the source tree will be created and from where the DSL files are read to be imported in CD/RO server.

formElement.label: Relative path to DSL files:
formElement.documentation: If the DSL files are not located at the top-level in the repository, then specify the relative path to the directory containing the DSL files within the repository. E.g., 'scripts/dsls' where the dsl files are located in the following sub-directories in the repository 'scripts/dsls/projects' and 'scripts/dsls/resources'.

formElement.label: Cleanup?:
formElement.documentation: This option will delete the destination directory with the source tree after the job execution.

formElement.label: Overwrite mode:
formElement.documentation: Overwrite mode, remove nonexistent in DSL elements.

formElement.label: Git repository:
formElement.documentation: URL to the repository to clone or pull from. ie: 'git://server/repo.git'.

formElement.label: Remote branch:
formElement.documentation: The name of the Git branch to use. ie: 'experimental'.

formElement.label: Ignore failures:
formElement.documentation: Ignore failures during import of DSL files.

formElement.label: Local mode:
formElement.documentation: Do not send files to the server with help of clientFiles argument of the evalDsl operation in local mode. Available only if the destination directory is accessible from the CD/RO server. In a clustered deployment, all CD/RO server nodes must have access to this directory.

formElement.label: Additional DSL arguments:
formElement.documentation: Additional argument(s) for evalDsl call. ie: --timeout or --debug. Values used in --timeout will be used as timeouts for ectool, evalDsl, and the job step time out used to import the DSL.

formElement.label: Include objects
formElement.documentation:
New line separated list of paths to objects to synchronize. If set, only these objects are synchronized. If empty, all available objects are synchronized.
Examples:
- “/projects“ - all projects
- “/projects/Default/applications“ - all applications in project 'Default'
- “/users“ - all users
- “/projects/Commander/procedures/Master“ - ‘Master' procedure in 'Commander’ project
- “/projects/*/releases“ - all releases in all projects
Objects with depth > 2 are not supported.
Examples:
- “/projects/*/releases/release1“
- “/projects/Default/application/application1/applicationTiers”

formElement.label: Exclude objects
formElement.documentation: List of paths to objects to exclude. Nothing by default

formElement.label: Incremental Import:
formElement.documentation:
This is an experimental feature, that is under review.
Use at your own risk.
It imports only changes thereby shortening the import process. To do so it relies on a change list from the source code repository plugin.
